orgSetting.name: appointmentricheditorexperience
orgSetting.description: When you enable the rich text experience, server-side synchronization and appointment activities support rich text. With the rich text editor, appointment descriptions can contain rich text. After enabling, if you choose to disable the setting, the appointment editor description field will reset to the plain-text field. Previously synchronized appointments' description will still contain rich-text HTML markup. Although the rich text editor can be used with appointment activities, it can’t be used with recurring appointments. When an appointment that contains rich text is converted to a recurring appointment, the description field for the activity is converted to a plain-text field containing rich text content.

orgSetting.name: EnableUnifiedInterfaceShellRefresh
orgSetting.description: As of 1/15/2019 the default is Disabled but the default may be True for newly provisioned instances. Enabled/True or enables the new UCI Sitemap, if this is set to disabled the new UCI sitemap changes will be disabled.

orgSetting.name: IsSOPIntegrationEnabled
orgSetting.description: Enables or disables the SOPIntegration, if this is ENABLED it *disables* sales order processing assuming an integration will handle it. *DO NOT SET TO TRUE UNLESS YOU HAVE A SPECIFIC REASON TO DO SO*

orgSetting.name: MaxRecordsForExportToExcel
orgSetting.description: Max number of records to export to Excel, the larger the number the longer the exports will take (generally).

orgSetting.name: AllowClientMessageBarAd
orgSetting.description: Enables or disables Outlook Client message bar advertisement.

orgSetting.name: ExpireSubscriptionsInDays
orgSetting.description: Max number of days before deleting inactive Outlook client subscriptions. We recommend you keep this to the default unelss you absolutely need to change it, be mindful of keeping the tracking info too long, or deleting it too soon.

orgSetting.name: ExpireChangeTrackingInDays
orgSetting.description: Maximum number of days to keep change tracking deleted record ID's - you want this value larger than the max# of days any change tracking dependant services sync with your system. Default is 30 days. .

orgSetting.name: MaximumActiveBusinessProcessFlowsAllowedPerEntity
orgSetting.description: Max number of business process flows per entity allowed. WARNING: if the value is greater than 10, you may see a decrease in your system’s performance when you switch processes or open a record that has an assigned business process flow. This may be especially noticeable if processes span multiple entities.

orgSetting.name: YammerGroupId
orgSetting.description: WARNING: This is used only to view your Yammer settings, you may remove the Yammer settings if you need to fall back to activity feeds, though this is recommended mostly for POC/Test CRM instances.

orgSetting.name: YammerNetworkPermalink
orgSetting.description: WARNING: This is used only to view your Yammer settings, you may remove the Yammer settings if you need to fall back to activity feeds, though this is recommended mostly for POC/Test CRM instances.

orgSetting.name: YammerOAuthAccessTokenExpired
orgSetting.description: WARNING: This is used only to view your Yammer settings, you may remove the Yammer settings using the button below only if you need to fall back to using activity feeds, though this is recommended mostly for POC/Test CRM instances.

orgSetting.name: pastexpansionwindow
orgSetting.description: Specifies the maximum number of months in past for which the recurring activities can be created.

orgSetting.name: ActivateAdditionalRefreshOfWorkflowConditions
orgSetting.description: Default: False. True:

orgSetting.name: ActivityConvertDlgCampaignUnchecked
orgSetting.description: Controls the default value of the Record Closed Campaign Response option. When converting an activity to an opportunity this default option controls whether the source campaign is set or not. False - Record Closed Campaign Response checked and source campaign will be set. True - Record Closed Campaign Response not checked and source campaign is not set.

orgSetting.name: AddressBookMaterializedViewsEnabled
orgSetting.description: Changes the way the CRM Client queries SQL CE. Default: True. False: will disable address book materialized views.

orgSetting.name: AutoCreateContactOnPromote
orgSetting.description: Disables the ability for the entire organization to create contact records automatically when an email is tracked in CRM. This option can also be disabled from the user settings area for each user. False - Disables the auto creation of contacts. True - Enables the auto creation of contacts.

orgSetting.name: BackgroundSendBatchSize
orgSetting.description: Max email batch size per user for sending emails in the background. This sets the number of emails to download in one batch for the BackgroundSend API.

orgSetting.name: ChangeDoubleQuoteToSingleQuote
orgSetting.description: UR14 and UR11+ with a COD update: By default CRM has, historically, converted double quotes to single quotes. In UR14 the behavior in CRM changes to preserve double quotes in KB articles, use this setting to revert the behavior back to changing double quotes to single quotes (true)

orgSetting.name: ClientDisableTrackingForReplyForwardEmails
orgSetting.description: Default: 0. 1: disables tracking of replies and forwarded emails.

orgSetting.name: ClientUEIPDisabled
orgSetting.description: Disables the sending of customer experience feedback for the organization. This option can also be disabled from the user settings area for each user. False - Enables the sending. True - Disables the sending.

orgSetting.name: CreateSPFoldersUsingNameandGuid
orgSetting.description: Default: True - creates SharePoint folders using the format of {Name}+{GUID}. False: Creates SharePoint folders using just the name.

orgSetting.name: DisableIECompatMode
orgSetting.description: Changes the server-side, automatic, IE Compatability Mode Flag for Internet Explorer browsers. If you want pages to render in the most recent version of Internet Explorer set this to True. If you have form scripts or other cusotmizations that require earlier versions of Internet Explorer this should be set to False. This is also controlled via Settings | Administration | System Settings | Customization

orgSetting.name: DisableImplicitSharingOfCommunicationActivities
orgSetting.description: Default: False. True: disables implicit sharing of records to recipients that are added to existing activities.

orgSetting.name: DisableInactiveRecordFilterForMailMerge
orgSetting.description: When performing a mail merge inactive records are not included in the mail merge. This option allows you to override that functionality. False - Inactive records will not be included in the mail merge. True - Inactive records will be included in the mail merge.

orgSetting.name: DisableMapiCaching
orgSetting.description: Default: True. False: will disable address book materialized views.

orgSetting.name: DisableSmartMatching
orgSetting.description: Disables the smart matching functionality and relies on the tracking token on the incoming e-mails for e-mail tracking. False - Enables smart matching True - Disables smart matching

orgSetting.name: DoNotIgnoreInternalEmailToQueues
orgSetting.description: If you disable the "Track e-mail sent between CRM users as two activities" setting, e-mail messages from a CRM user to a queue are not delivered. Additionally, if a workflow rule sends an e-mail message to a queue, e-mail messages that are sent by the workflow rule are not delivered. False - Internal e-mail messages to queues will not be delivered. True - Internal e-mail messages to queues will be delivered.

orgSetting.name: EnableBulkReparent
orgSetting.description: Default: True. False: Disables and reparents using a one record at a time approach.

orgSetting.name: EnableQuickFindOptimization
orgSetting.description: For more information see the Optimizing the Performance of Quick Find Queries section in the Optimizing and Maintaining the Performance of a Dynamics CRM 2011 Server Infrastructure

orgSetting.name: EnableReLinkingToExistingCRMRecord
orgSetting.description: V6 Default: False. True:

orgSetting.name: EnableRetrieveMultipleOptimization
orgSetting.description: For more information see the Optimizing the Performance of Queries against Large Datasets section in the Optimizing and Maintaining the Performance of a Dynamics CRM 2011 Server Infrastructure

orgSetting.name: IdsCountBeforeUsingJoinsForSecurity
orgSetting.description: Not yet documented in optimization paper.

orgSetting.name: IdsCountForUsingGuidStringForSecurity
orgSetting.description: Not yet documented in optimization paper.

orgSetting.name: IfdAuthenticationMethod
orgSetting.description:
Changes the request sent to the ADFS server, this settings default value is NULL (which will not change anything). This changes the authentication when users access the org using the context https://orgName.domain.com/. Valid values are:
an empty string (to reset to NULL use reset to default).
urn:federation:authentication:windows as a value uses - Integrated auth
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password as a value uses - Forms

orgSetting.name: IntegratedAuthenticationMethod
orgSetting.description:
Changes the request sent to the ADFS server, this settings default value is NULL (which will not change anything). This changes the authentication when users access the org using the context https://internal.domain.com/org. Valid values are:
an empty string (to reset to NULL use reset to default).
urn:federation:authentication:windows as a value uses - Integrated auth
urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password as a value uses - Forms

orgSetting.name: JumpBarAlphabetOverride
orgSetting.description: Allows for customization of the Alphabet Bar for the CRM Application Grids for Microsoft Dynamics CRM

orgSetting.name: JumpBarNumberIndicatorOverride
orgSetting.description: Allows for customization of the Alphabet Bar for the CRM Application Grids for Microsoft Dynamics CRM

orgSetting.name: LookupNameMatchesDuringImport
orgSetting.description: Importing a solution that was created from an upgraded 4.0 deployment fails. Changing this setting makes the import look up the names for forms, views, workflows and security roles.

orgSetting.name: OverrideTrackInCrmBehaviour
orgSetting.description: When this option is Enabled the Track in CRM button will function like the Set Regarding button. 0 - Normal behavior of the Track in CRM button not having to set a Regarding record. 1 - Track in CRM will function like the Set Regarding and make you choose a regarding record.

orgSetting.name: OverrideV5SenderConflictResolution
orgSetting.description: When multiple records with the same e-mail address exist in the Dynamics CRM Organization and e-mail is auto tracked the e-mail is resolved to the record that was created first. This option allows you to override that functionality.False - E-mails are tracked to the first record created True - E-mails are not tracked automatically if there are multiple records with the same e-mail address.

orgSetting.name: RecordCountLimitToSwitchToCteSecuritySql
orgSetting.description: For more information see the Optimizing the Performance of Queries against Large Datasets section in the Optimizing and Maintaining the Performance of a Dynamics CRM 2011 Server Infrastructure. Warning: do not increase this value unless it's for a *very* specific reason.

orgSetting.name: RetrieveMultipleSharingCountThreshold
orgSetting.description: For more information see the Optimizing the Performance of Queries against Large Datasets section in the Optimizing and Maintaining the Performance of a Dynamics CRM 2011 Server Infrastructure

orgSetting.name: SendEmailSynchronously
orgSetting.description: If you have a plugin registered on the e-mail send flow you will want to update this setting to 1.0 - E-mail is sent asynchronously 1 - E-mail is sent synchronously

orgSetting.name: SetRegardingLookupDefaultEntityType
orgSetting.description: Change default entity for Regarding Lookup Dialog

orgSetting.name: SharingLimitForPOASnapshotTable
orgSetting.description: Not yet documented in optimization paper.

orgSetting.name: SkipGettingRecordCountForPaging
orgSetting.description: Disables the record count query. This query is responsible for getting the total number of records returned for each view. This query can cause longer search times and may lead to SQL timeouts or Exceptions. False - Enables record count on views. True - Disables record count on views.

orgSetting.name: SkipSuffixOnKBArticles
orgSetting.description: When you create a knowledge base (KB) article the KB article number uses the "Prefix-Number-Suffix" format. You expect the format to be "Prefix-Number." For more info see KB: 981840

orgSetting.name: TabletClientMaxFields
orgSetting.description: Default: 75. Max mobile fields.

orgSetting.name: TabletClientMaxLists
orgSetting.description: Default: 10. Max tablet lists.

orgSetting.name: TabletClientMaxTabs
orgSetting.description: Default: 5. Max tablet tabs.

orgSetting.name: TraceExchangeSyncData
orgSetting.description: Default: False. True: Enabled exchange sync tracing.

orgSetting.name: UsePlainTextForEmailTemplateBody
orgSetting.description: Will set CRM to send emails with only plain text instead of HTML text.

orgSetting.name: VerboseErrorsOnPromoteToCRM
orgSetting.description: Enables verbose user error messaging when tracking items from Outlook to Dynamics CRM. By default some error messages during the tracking are suppressed from being shown to the end user and this setting enables those errors to be shown. 0 - Disables the verbose errors. 1 - Enables the verbose errors.

orgSetting.name: AllowPromoteDuplicates
orgSetting.description:
V6 Default: False. Options are: False: Does not allow for the promotion of duplicate records. True: Allows for the promotion of duplicate records.
NOTE: This setting is NOT SUPPORTED IN CRM2013 as of build 809.

orgSetting.name: GrantSharedAccessForMergeToSubordinateOwner
orgSetting.description:
Added back in 6.1.0.581! Default: true. Options are:
true:Copy all inhertied shares from master share records
false: Do not copy master records inherited shares.

orgSetting.name: ListComponentInstalled
orgSetting.description:
Added back in 6.1.0.581! If CRM and SharePoint use ADFS and users click to create a folder for a record in CRM 2013, intermittently, the SharePoint page is shown instead of the list part grid page causing confusion with users. This setting allows you to force CRM to use the installed list grid component in SharePoint when using ADFS.
Default: false. Options are:
false: use the standard method of detecting Sharepoint Authentication
true: If CRM and SharePoint have ADFS enabled, force CRM to use the grid display.

orgSetting.name: SecuritySettingForEmail
orgSetting.description:
Default: 1. Options are:
1:Display a Warning Message And give an option to open
2: Display a Warning Message and do not give an option to open
3: Do not display a Warning Message and do not give any option to open.
NOTE:

orgSetting.name: StoreOutlookSyncDataInSensitivityProperty
orgSetting.description:
Added back in 6.1.0.581! Default: true. Options are:
true:Preserve existing behavior.
false: Stop storing CRM Sync information in the PidTagSensitivity MAPI property which causes the error: error in the XML document on GetItem for IPM.MSCRMUserId on BlackerBerry Server Traces.

orgSetting.name: EnableCrmStatecodeOnOutlookCategory
orgSetting.description: Enable Statecode data on contact sync. Default: True. False:

orgSetting.name: ClearSystemUserPrincipalsWhenDisable
orgSetting.description: Clear and/or populates SystemUserPrincipals values for systemUsers when they're disabled/enabled. Default: True. False:

orgSetting.name: DisableLookupMruOnOutlookOffline
orgSetting.description: LookupMRUItems in UserEntityUISettings can cause a large data volume when going online, setting this to true will stop MRU's from syncing back ONLINE. The default of false will have users OFFLINE outlook clients sync the MRU items back to the server after being offline. To reduce the time taken to go back ONLINE for offline client users you can set this to true.

orgSetting.name: HierarchyLevelForHierarchyFeature
orgSetting.description: HierarchyLevelForHierarchyFeature - the hierarchy level used for hierarchal security.

orgSetting.name: MaximumChildUsersCountLimitBeforeUsingJoinForHSM
orgSetting.description: Maximum Child/Subordinate Users Count Before Using a Join For HSM

orgSetting.name: MinRowCountForFKIndexCreateInReferencedEntity
orgSetting.description: Setting min row count in referenced table for ForeignKey index creation

orgSetting.name: MinRowCountForFKIndexCreateInReferencingEntity
orgSetting.description: Setting min row count in referencing table for ForeignKey index creation

orgSetting.name: PageSizeForHierarchyFeature
orgSetting.description: PageSizeForHierarchyFeature - the hierarchy page size used for hierarchal security.

orgSetting.name: EnableAppointmentBroadcastingForOutlookSync
orgSetting.description: Setting for Appointment broadcasting for Outlook Synchronization

orgSetting.name: GrantFullAccessForMergeToMasterOwner
orgSetting.description: Previous less desirable behavior will default to true, to preserve existing functionality. The more desirable behavior is achieved with the setting of: false. Details: When two records owned by the same team are merged, the final record is shared with the owner of the record it was merged from. This creates redundant POA records, as a result, if the owner of the record is changed in the future it will be visible to team members of the previously owning team.

orgSetting.name: OutlookClientEmailTaggerEnabled
orgSetting.description: WARNING!!! - read this carefully as there are 3 values for this Boolean setting - true, false, and NULL (which is the value when NOT set - to get back to NULL, simply remove this settings by clicking Remove in the edit box). TRUE: Will override any and all client registry setting to True. FALSE: Will override any and all client registry setting to False. NULL: If the setting is NULL the outlook clients will use whatever is in the registry of the client. TO SET THIS VALUE TO NULL YOU WILL NEED TO CLICK EDIT, THEN REMOVE THE VALUE TO HAVE IT DEFAULT TO NULL.

orgSetting.name: ExportedExcelRetentionWindow
orgSetting.description: 7.1: The number of days to temporarily store Excel exported Office Document Records. 30 days max was selected arbitrarily as this is only a cache. Must be at least 2.

orgSetting.name: OfficeDocumentPersistenceTimeInDays
orgSetting.description: 7.1: The number of days to temporarily store Office Document Records. 30 days max was selected arbitrarily as this is only a cache.

orgSetting.name: OutlookSyncDataSubscriptionClientsBatchSize
orgSetting.description: 7.1: This setting is used to determine how many record changes (deletes, inserts, and updates) to send back to a syncing client for each request.

orgSetting.name: DefaultHeightForWizardReports
orgSetting.description: UR14: With a default value 0: CRM will use 8.25 inches (A4), any other double value will override the default of 8.25. Some printers may reject printed reports if the height is any less than the height of the paper loaded in the tray, this setting will override the height used.

orgSetting.name: DisableClientUpdateNotification
orgSetting.description: Setting DisableClientUpdateNotification to true will disable the outlook client from checking for newer versions.

orgSetting.name: DisableNavTour
orgSetting.description: Override the navigation tour setting for the entire Organization this allows you to permanently disable the welcome screen shown to users when they first login to CRM - if this is set to false, a user will be shown the navigation tour every time their browser cookies expire or are cleared and when they login to CRM from an unkown browser (like on a shared PC or different computer).

orgSetting.name: ReassignAllExtendedTimeout
orgSetting.description: Increase script timeout for reassigning all records of a user or team - this allows you to exceed the default extended timeout value. Default extended timeout is 1000000 ms (roughly 15 minutes). WARNING: Care should be taken when increasing this value above the default - always double check the number of minutes before setting this to a value higher than the default.

orgSetting.name: MailboxStatisticsPersistenceTimeInDays
orgSetting.description: If value is 0, dont store ANY MailboxStatistics Data, if the value is greater than zero then store that number of days statistics data. Max value arbitrarily chosen at 1 year, this generates at lot of data so 1 year should be plenty of time.

orgSetting.name: SortEmailsByReceivedOn
orgSetting.description: When the Activities tab of the social pane is show, the data ordered by the 'modifiedon' date in descending order, toggling this setting to True will enable the social pane to sort emails by RecievedOn Desc instead of modifiedon.

orgSetting.name: MailboxStatisticsPersistenceTimeInDays
orgSetting.description: If value is 0, dont store ANY MailboxStatistics Data, if the value is greater than zero then store that number of days statistics data. Max value arbitrarily chosen at 1 year, this generates at lot of data so 1 year should be plenty of time.

orgSetting.name: SecurityQueryHint
orgSetting.description: Used to hint the query within GetRightsFromPrincipalObjectAccess - in large environments optimize for unknown will have less CPU impact. 0=None; 1=Recompile; 2=OptimizeForUnkown (new default)

orgSetting.name: DisableClientUpdateNotification
orgSetting.description: Setting DisableClientUpdateNotification to true will disable the outlook client from checking for newer versions.

orgSetting.name: DisableNavTour
orgSetting.description: Override the navigation tour setting for the entire Organization this allows you to permanently disable the welcome screen shown to users when they first login to CRM - if this is set to false, a user will be shown the navigation tour every time their browser cookies expire or are cleared and when they login to CRM from an unkown browser (like on a shared PC or different computer).

orgSetting.name: MakeSocialPanePhoneCallCompleted
orgSetting.description: By default (true) Phone calls created in the Social Pane are automatically marked in a completed state and cannot be edited. Changing this value to False will create phone calls and will NOT mark them as completed.

orgSetting.name: UseCrmOrganizerForEmptyExchangeOrganizer
orgSetting.description: Tells CRM to use the appointments 'CRM' information as the organizer of an Appointment if the Organizer information doesnt exist/cannot be found in Exchange.

orgSetting.name: SkipGettingRecordCountForPagingForAudit
orgSetting.description: This setting will disable the total record count for audit queries.

orgSetting.name: SolutionExportExtendedTimeout
orgSetting.description: This setting makes it possible to override the solution export timeout, this setting is in milliseconds and the default platform timeout is 1000000ms (about 16 minutes). If this setting is set to any number LESS than the extendedTimeout value will be ignored and the extendedTimeout will be used instead. This setting will ensure your timeout is at least this number of ms long.

orgSetting.name: TraceLogPersistenceTimeInDays
orgSetting.description: Setting for (mailbox) TraceLog persistence Time in Days - this is only for mailbox trace logs.

orgSetting.name: UseOrganizationServiceForMultiEntityQuickFind
orgSetting.description: Forces the use of the organization service when executing a multi entity quickfind which will ensure all plugins are fired upon quickfind operations

orgSetting.name: ForceRetrievePublishedMetadataForRetrieveAllEntities
orgSetting.description: Not available

orgSetting.name: ForceRetrievePublishedMetadataForRetrieveAllEntities
orgSetting.description: Not available

orgSetting.name: ForceRetrievePublishedMetadataForRetrieveAllEntities
orgSetting.description: Not available

orgSetting.name: FullTextSpecialCharactersToRemoveFromSearchToken
orgSetting.description: Special characters to remove from the full text search token (available in onprem only today), default is none.

orgSetting.name: officeShellServiceTimeout
orgSetting.description: Default 5 seconds. Override time (in seconds) to wait for the office shell service to respond upon rendering the main UI.

orgSetting.name: DistinctPhysicalAndLogicalDeletesForExchangeSync
orgSetting.description:
Default False. Server-Side synchronization mechanism to distinguish between Logical and Physical deletes of records in CRM False: *DEFAULT* No distinction between physical and logical deletes for exchange sync delete scenario. True: Physical and logical deletes will be distinguished for exchange sync record deletions.

Example: Jayne has Server-Side synchronization (SSS) enabled and tracked appointment 'bike repair' in CRM. If Jayne lost read access to 'bike repair' (logical delete of 'bike repair' for Jayne), then SSS with default behavior will delete 'bike repair' from Exchange. With DistinctPhysicalAndLogicalDeletesForExchangeSync==true, logical deletions of 'bike repair' for Jayne will NOT delete 'bike repair' from Exchange.

orgSetting.name: UseOrganizationServiceForMultiEntityQuickFind
orgSetting.description: Forces the use of the organization service when executing a multi entity quickfind which will ensure all plugins are fired upon quickfind operations

orgSetting.name: DefaultHeightForWizardReports
orgSetting.description: UR14: With a default value 0: CRM will use 8.25 inches (A4), any other double value will override the default of 8.25. Some printers may reject printed reports if the height is any less than the height of the paper loaded in the tray, this setting will override the height used.

orgSetting.name: DoNotIgnoreInternalEmailToQueues
orgSetting.description: If you disable the "Track e-mail sent between CRM users as two activities" setting, e-mail messages from a CRM user to a queue are not delivered. Additionally, if a workflow rule sends an e-mail message to a queue, e-mail messages that are sent by the workflow rule are not delivered. False - Internal e-mail messages to queues will not be delivered. True - Internal e-mail messages to queues will be delivered.

orgSetting.name: RestrictIRMEmailItems
orgSetting.description: Setting value to TRUE will result in Server Side Sync NOT synchronizing ALL emails that are marked as IRM emails.Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior. To enable this restriction on the organization RestrictIRMEmailItems should be set to True.

orgSetting.name: AutoTrackSentFolderItems
orgSetting.description: Setting value to TRUE will result in Server Side Sync auto tracking of emails from Sent Items. Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior. To enable functionality on the organization AutoTrackSentFolderItems should be set to True.

orgSetting.name: TrackCategorizedItems
orgSetting.description: Setting value to TRUE will result in Server Side Sync creating a track to Dynamics category to be used for Exchange items. Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior.

orgSetting.name: TrackCategorizedItems
orgSetting.description: Setting value to TRUE will result in Server Side Sync creating a track to Dynamics category to be used for Exchange items. Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior.

orgSetting.name: TrackCategorizedItems
orgSetting.description: Setting value to False will remove the category tracking flag and functionality. Default value is set to True (for Dynamics 365 Online) and will allow category tracking and tracking status visibility for users whom do not use Dynamics 365 for Outlook or Dynamics 365 App for Outlook.

orgSetting.name: EnableSssItemLevelMonitoring
orgSetting.description: Setting value to True will enable a new dashboard accessible by users and administrators called Server-Side Synchronization Failures. This dashboard allows the owner of a mailbox to have information about all non-synched incoming/outgoing emails and also appointment, contact, and task (ACT) items. Information is provided for the reason items are not synchronized. Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior.

orgSetting.name: EnableSssItemLevelMonitoring
orgSetting.description: Setting value to True will enable a new dashboard accessible by users and administrators called Server-Side Synchronization Failures. This dashboard allows the owner of a mailbox to have information about all non-synched incoming/outgoing emails and also appointment, contact, and task (ACT) items. Information is provided for the reason items are not synchronized. Default value is set to False to preserve the existing behavior.

orgSetting.name: AllowSaveAsDraftAppointment
orgSetting.description: Setting value to True will allow saving draft appointments (isdraft property) using the DeliverIncoming api call. Default value is set to False.

orgSetting.name: TrackAppointmentsFromNonOrganizer
orgSetting.description: Allows CDS server side sync to track appointments where the syncing user mailbox was *NOT* the organizer of the appointment. Default value is set to true.

orgSetting.name: TrackAppointmentsFromNonOrganizer
orgSetting.description: Allows CDS server side sync to track appointments where the syncing user mailbox was *NOT* the organizer of the appointment. Default value is set to false.

orgSetting.name: TrackAppointmentsFromNonOrganizer
orgSetting.description: Allows CDS server side sync to track appointments where the syncing user mailbox was *NOT* the organizer of the appointment. Default value is set to false.

orgSetting.name: ExchangeSyncIdMappingPersistenceTimeInDays
orgSetting.description: The length of time for CDS to maintain ExchangeIDMapping FAILURE RECORDS - after this length of time the failures will be purged. Default value is set to 3

orgSetting.name: EnableViewSelectorForEmailTemplatesInPersonalOptionsDialog
orgSetting.description: Setting to true Enables the View Selector For EmailTemplates in the personalOptions Dialog. Default value is set to false.

orgSetting.name: ResolveForInactiveEntities
orgSetting.description: Setting to true allows service side sync to resolve contacts/recipients to inactive emailable entity records. Setting it to False ensures inactive records are skipped when resolving. Default value is set to false.

orgSetting.name: MaximumSubjectLengthOnMailServer
orgSetting.description: Set the maximum subject length permissible for the ***mail*** server. This will ensure server side sync concatinates the subject of emails sent from CDS/Dynamics.

orgSetting.name: HideTrackAllOption
orgSetting.description: Org setting to hide 'All email messages' track option from Personal Options (Email). Default: false

orgSetting.name: IgnoreConversationIndexAndInReplyToForCorrelation
orgSetting.description: Org setting to ignore conversation index and in reply to during correlation. Default: false

orgSetting.name: UseFilteringMethodOfSyncingMailboxOnlyForCorrelation
orgSetting.description: Org setting to use filtering method of syncing mailbox only for correlation and ignore other email recipients. Default: False

orgSetting.name: DelegateAccessEnabled
orgSetting.description: Org setting to enable Delegate Access. Default: false

orgSetting.name: UseXAnchorMailboxInExchangeRequestHeader
orgSetting.description: Org setting to add XAnchor mailbox to each request header to Exchange. Default: false

orgSetting.name: UseXAnchorMailboxInExchangeRequestHeader
orgSetting.description: Org setting to add XAnchor mailbox to each request header to Exchange. Default: false

orgSetting.name: HideEmailAutoTrackOptions
orgSetting.description: Default value is false, if it's set to True: do not show the following track options in Personal Options (Email): 'All email messages', 'Email messages from D365 Leads, Contacts and Accounts', 'Email messages from D365 records that are email enabled'

orgSetting.name: BUIdsCountBeforeUsingSubqueryForPostsSecurity
orgSetting.description: Limits the BUid's parameterized in the query and will fall back to using a subquery to avoid having too man sql parameters.

orgSetting.name: SocialPaneQueryHint
orgSetting.description:
Expected values:
None = -1,
OptimizeForUnknown = 0,
ForceOrder = 1,
Recompile = 2,
DisableRowGoal =3
Any value outside this range will be treated as -1.

orgSetting.name: UseDeletePrivilegeInsteadOfAppendToForChildEntityDelete
orgSetting.description: Use With Caution:Use Delete privilege checks and AccessRights checks instead of AppendTo during Deletion of child entity

orgSetting.name: DisableSharePointConnectionKeepAlive
orgSetting.description: Use With Caution:Disables the Sharepoint Sync connection KeepAlive property - this should only be used with specific guidance when using an OnPrem Sharepoint URL with Sharepoint Sync and when the onprem sharepoint server has too small of a TLS KeepAlive time configured on their Sharepoint IIS server or NLB

orgSetting.name: EmailEditorSkipNewLineInIE
orgSetting.description: Resolution to address the p tag issue in IE

orgSetting.name: HideStageAndUpgrade
orgSetting.description: Hide the old UI for stage solution. Show the new option to Upgrade Solutions

orgSetting.name: QueryColumnCountToForceOrBasedSecurityPredicate
orgSetting.description: indicates what count of columns in a query is considered 'high', which may cause the security layer to use a different predicate format to keep the query as small as possible and keep the plan in the plan cache small; -1 is disabled

orgSetting.name: PercentageOfAccessibleRecordsToUseOrBasedSecurityPredicate
orgSetting.description: -1 is disabled (default). Add support to change the security filter predicate on RetrieveMultiple based on a given percentage of records visible

orgSetting.name: EnableActivitiesTimeLinePerfImprovement
orgSetting.description: 1 to enable, 0 to disable(preserve existing behavior)

orgSetting.name: EnableActivitiesFeatures
orgSetting.description: Bitmask to Enable various activities feature in UCI; 1 to enable, 0 to disable(preserve existing behavior)

orgSetting.name: SortURIQueryParameters
orgSetting.description: False to disable, True to disable(preserve existing behavior). If true, we are sorting the query URI parameters.

orgSetting.name: AllowParamsNoEquals
orgSetting.description: True to enable, False to disable(preserve existing behavior). True will to skip the = in the query URI for empty string parameters

orgSetting.name: InheritedRolePrivilegesFromTeamRoles
orgSetting.description:
Disables inheritance of user/basic depth role privileges from team basic depth role privileges for all roles. .
False- members of group teams are required to have their own security role assigned to them directly.
True– By default members of group teams shall inherit user/basic privileges directly and user privileges are derived at run-time

orgSetting.name: AllowRoleAssignmentOnDisabledUsers
orgSetting.description:
Enables the assignment of security role for users with a disabled status. This allows scenario where customers can create stub users and assign a different security role. This is needed so that stub/disabled users can own records especially where these records are from custom entities where custom security roles are required.
False - By default, security role cannot be assigned to users with disabled status.
This is shipped by default.True – Allows security role to be assigned to users with disabled status.

orgSetting.name: SkipAadGroupObjectIdValidation
orgSetting.description:
Disables the validation of Azure AD Group objectID and allows application to create Group team in CDS. This is to mitigate the latency in the Azure AD distributed cache where a newly created Azure AD group cannot be validated if the subsequent Azure AD Group graph call goes to a distributed cache server that does not have the new Azure AD group yet.
False - do not skip Azure AD group objectID validation during Group Team creation. This is shipped by default.
True – skip Azure AD group objectID validation to allow application to create Group team.

orgSetting.name: CanCreateApplicationStubUser
orgSetting.description: Allow the creation of application stub user

orgSetting.name: WorkflowXamlValidationErrorReport
orgSetting.description: WorkflowXamlValidationErrorReport is used to fail workflow loads if the XAML is not valid

orgSetting.name: AuditRetentionPeriod
orgSetting.description: -1 is forever, otherwise the value should be 30 days or greater. All audit records that fall beyond the maximum retention will eventually be deleted.

orgSetting.name: ActivityRollupChildRecordLimit
orgSetting.description: Limit the number of total aggregated activities to rollup in the Actvity Rollup Default:10,000. Used with: VisibleRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF and TotalRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF

orgSetting.name: VisibleRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF
orgSetting.description: Used for activity rollup performance tuning along with: TotalRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF and ActivityRollupChildRecordLimit

orgSetting.name: TotalRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF
orgSetting.description: Used for activity rollup performance tuning along with: VisibleRecordThreshholdSwitchToMultiplelineTVF and ActivityRollupChildRecordLimit

orgSetting.name: IsCommandingModifiedOnEnabled
orgSetting.description: Setting to indicate if command bar rendering should use ModifiedOn date for ordering instead of VersionNumber, VersionNumber would be ordered by when it was added or updated in the database irrespective of the modifiedon date

orgSetting.name: BPFInstanceDaysModifiedForOfflineSync
orgSetting.description: control the last x days of BPF Instances to sync during offline sync

orgSetting.name: AlwaysCheckTraceLogDeletePrivilege
orgSetting.description: Note: TraceLog is used to log ServerSide Sync messages (not plugin logs). False: Only allow the user to delete if they are the *owner* of the regarding object. If the setting is True: if unconditional privilege checks are enabled or if the caller has prvDeleteTraceLog then allow the user to delete the trace log entries.

orgSetting.name: DoNotAutoTrackEmail
orgSetting.description: Disable all Auto tracking of any emails

orgSetting.name: ValidateContactBeforeTracking
orgSetting.urlTitle: Dynamics 365 App for Outlook User Guide
orgSetting.description: ValidateContactBeforeTracking OrgDBOrgSettings allows to enable\disable validation of contact's fields during tracking Outlook contacts in Dynamics 365 apps. By default validation is turned on.

orgSetting.name: IgnoreCopiedItemsInSSSForMailbox
orgSetting.description: Ignore creating duplicate for copied items for Server Side Sync

orgSetting.name: EmailTemplateRetrieveFallbackContact
orgSetting.description:
Scenario: Opportunity/case which refer to a customerId of type account and do that account does not have a primary contact specified.
False: (Default behavior) Use the primary account and retrieve the primary contact, if the account is null it will leave the contact field in the email template null.
True: Fall back to using the Opportunity or Case primaryContactId if the account reference is null.

orgSetting.name: CreateQueueItemForSynchronizingMailbox
orgSetting.description: When tracking an email into Dynamics, create a queue item for the queue which is synchronizing the email message (this will affect queue item creation for mailboxes in the BCC line or contained in a distribution list.)

orgSetting.name: DupeDetectionSkipIfNoMatchCodeFieldsChanged
orgSetting.description: Skip duplicate detection record updates if none of the relevant/included match code fields change.

orgSetting.name: EnableTDSEndpoint
orgSetting.description: Enable a SQL TDS Endpoint for your CDS Environment - NOTE: your region will also have to support TDS endpoints, the regions with support for TDS may vary (as documented in the docs url provided here). To change this setting, please navigate to Power Platform Admin Center.

orgSetting.name: EnableLicenseEnforcement
orgSetting.description: Online only setting to enable license enforcing for organizations/environments created before 4/1/2020 for customer testing purposes

orgSetting.name: CleanInheritedAccessWhenReparentOrShareCascadingNone
orgSetting.description: Clean out all inherited access when reparenting or after cascade sharing is set to none

orgSetting.name: SSSPropagateAppointmentCancellationsToExchange
orgSetting.description: Enabling the feature allows appointment cancellations from Dynamics to propagate to Exchange via SSS.

orgSetting.name: IgnoreInternalEmailDetectionEnhancement
orgSetting.description: Enabled by default, improves the detection logic when IgnoreInternalEmail is enabled. The previous behavior would reject any emails that sent from CRM users, regardless of whether the originating email was sent from Dynamics. The new logic now checks for an opposite direction code of the email, with the same messageIdm, before rejecting. For example, if the process evaluates an incoming email sent from another CRM user, the email will be rejected by this process only if the system can locate a copy of the email with the opposite direction code (outgoing) and messageId in Dynamics. Otherwise, the email will continue to be evaluated for tracking in accordance with the recipient track settings.

orgSetting.name: MailAppWindowsIntegratedAuthEnabled
orgSetting.description: This feature is only valid for OnPrem deployments and allows user to use windows integrated authentication to login to CRM and mailapp and user doesn't need to explicitly login.

orgSetting.name: SSSForceFilteringMethodForUserMailboxes
orgSetting.description:
Description: Overrides the incoming email filtering method for all user mailboxes based on the below values:
-1 Setting Disabled.
 0 All Email Messages
 1 Email Messages in Response to Dynamics 365 Email
 2 Email Messages from Leads, Contacts, and Accounts
 3 Email Messages from Dynamics 365 Records that are Email Enabled
 4 No Email Messages.
Default Value: -1

orgSetting.name: CreateQueueItemsForAcceptingQueueRecipients
orgSetting.description: When enabled, the system will create a queue item for each queue recipient during incoming email processing. If AutoRouteToOwnerQueue is enabled, the system additionally creates a queue item in the email owner’s default queue.

orgSetting.name: SSSCreateAdditionalQueueItemsForAlreadyTrackedEmail
orgSetting.description: When enabled, Server-Side Synchronization will create an additional queue item for an email found in a queue mailbox if the email has already been delivered to Dynamics by another user or queue.

orgSetting.name: MailAppWindowsIntegratedAuthEnabled
orgSetting.description: When enabled, allows the app four outlook to use windows integration authentication.

orgSetting.name: EnableMailboxDelegationForOutgoingEmail
orgSetting.description: When enabled, Server Side Sync will use the Dynamics and Exchange mailbox of the email submitter to send the email and not the mailbox of the user / queue in the from field. This is only supported on the Exchange OnPrem / Exchange online Email Server Profile. Proper delegation permissions need to be assigned in Exchange for the email submitter. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/Exchange/recipients/mailbox-permissions?view=exchserver-2019

orgSetting.name: DisableSmartMatchingEmailHashCreation
orgSetting.description: This setting will allow a customer that is not (and never will) use Smart Matching to prevent the creation of EmailHashBase data. Even with Smart Matching disabled this data will still be created during email processing which can affect both performance and storage. If you do not want to use Smart Matching and forsee never using smart matching this will enable you to reduce storage and improve performance.

orgSetting.name: SSSUpdatePastMeetingsInNonDraftMode
orgSetting.description: Allows updates for past meetings to flow when critical properties have changed(start, end, attendees, location).

orgSetting.name: SSSSyncAppointmentIsPrivateFromExchange
orgSetting.description: Allows the flow of IsPrivate on appointment from Exchange to CRM as a one way sync where the IsPrivate value in Exchange will be the source of truth.

orgSetting.name: MailAppMSAL
orgSetting.description: Enable MSAL authentication for the mail app

orgSetting.name: SSSSaveOutgoingEmailToExchangeSentFolder
orgSetting.description: Determines if emails sent from CRM using SSS should be saved to the sent items folder in Exchange.

orgSetting.name: AllowDisabledUsersAddedToOwnerTeams
orgSetting.description: Adding this property to allows adding of disabled users to owner teams.

orgSetting.name: DoNotRemoveRolesOnChangeBusinessUnit
orgSetting.description: Adding this property determines if roles are removed when principal changes business units. WARNING: this setting may take a long time to save when changed.

orgSetting.name: AlwaysMoveRecordToOwnerBusinessUnit
orgSetting.description: Adding this property determines if a record's business unit updates to owner's BU when owner changes. WARNING: this setting may take a long time to save when changed.

orgSetting.name: EnableOwnershipAcrossBusinessUnits
orgSetting.description: Online only setting to enable Record Ownership Across Business Units. WARNING: this setting may take a long time to save when changed.

orgSetting.name: RecomputeOwnershipAcrossBusinessUnits
orgSetting.description: Online only setting to recompute Record Ownership Across Business Units. WARNING: this setting may take a long time to save when changed.

orgSetting.name: ManagersMustBeInSameOrParentBusinessUnitAsReports
orgSetting.description: Adding this property determines if managers need to be in parent or same BU as direct reports. WARNING: this setting may take a long time to save when changed.

orgSetting.name: CreateQueueItemForSynchronizingMailbox
orgSetting.description: When tracking an email into Dynamics, create a queue item for the queue which is synchronizing the email message (this will affect queue item creation for mailboxes in the BCC line or contained in a distribution list.)

orgSetting.name: IgnoreInternalEmailFromQueues
orgSetting.description:
If you disable the "Track email sent between CRM users as two activities" setting, email messages from a CRM Queue to a System User/Queue are still delivered as incoming email.
False: Incoming Internal Emails from Queues are still evaluated for promotion
True: Incoming Internal Emails from Queues are rejected in the event a sent message exists with the same MessageID.

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationSkipAadUserStateValidation
orgSetting.description: SystemUser delete will skip Azure Active Directory user state validation.)

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationExpiredDataCleanUpInDays
orgSetting.description: Internal precomputed authorization data clean up after days for inactive user)

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationTransactionTimeOutInMilliSeconds
orgSetting.description: The value in milli seconds to use as a timeout for authorization stored procedures. The default value is 10 mins)

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationAppLockTimeOutInMilliSeconds
orgSetting.description: the value in milli seconds to use as an app lock timeout for authorization stored procedures. The default value is 5 mins.)

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationLockUserTimeOutInSeconds
orgSetting.description: The value in seconds to use to lock user for authorization data recompute.)

orgSetting.name: IsArchivalEnabled
orgSetting.description: Enabling/Disabling archival feature for an organization.

orgSetting.name: EnableTDSArchival
orgSetting.description: Enabling/Disabling TDS archival feature for an organization.

orgSetting.name: SSSTaskDeletionSyncBehaviorFromExchange
orgSetting.description:
Specifies how task deletions in Exchange are synchronized to their linked Dynamics 365 activity record.
0: Tasks deleted in Exchange are deleted in Dynamics (default).
1: Tasks deleted in Exchange are deleted in Dynamics if they are not completed.
2: Tasks deleted in Exchange are never deleted in Dynamics.

orgSetting.name: EnableModernRoleEditor
orgSetting.description: The setting is used to turn on/off security role editor UI in Power platform admin center.

orgSetting.name: RequirePrivilegeToSelfApproveEmailAddress
orgSetting.description: When enabled, a user needs the Approve Email Addresses for Users or Queues privilege to approve their own mailbox.

orgSetting.name: SetCallerAsDefaultOwnerForNewEntities
orgSetting.description: Adding this property determines if new entities created will set the caller as owner.

orgSetting.name: IsAccessCheckerAllUsersEnabled
orgSetting.description: Allow Non-Admin users to see All User's access.

orgSetting.name: IsAccessCheckerNonAdminAllUsersEnabled
orgSetting.description: Allow Non-Admin users to see All User's access.

orgSetting.name: AzureSynapseLinkIncrementalUpdateTimeInterval
orgSetting.description: Time (minutes) Interval for AzureSynapseLink IncrementalUpdate

orgSetting.name: DaysBeforeEmailDescriptionIsMigrated
orgSetting.description: Number of days to wait to migrate Email Description to blob (max 365).

orgSetting.name: MaxEntitiesEnabledForAutoCreatedAccessTeams
orgSetting.description: Alter the maximum number of entities enabled for Auto Created Access Teams

orgSetting.name: MaxAutoCreatedAccessTeamsPerEntity
orgSetting.description: Alter the maximum number of Access teams created per entity

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationCountMissedPrivilegesToReturn
orgSetting.description: Count of missed privileges to return in exception message.

orgSetting.name: AuthorizationEnableHSMForDisabledUsers
orgSetting.description: When enabled, manager can read disabled users records.

orgSetting.name: EnableLicenseEnforcementApi
orgSetting.description: When enabled API license enforcement will be executed.

orgSetting.name: AssertOwnershipAppendToAccess
orgSetting.description: When enabled Assign will validate AppendTo Access.

orgSetting.name: UnresolveSenderInCaseOfMultipleMatch
orgSetting.description: When enabled, email sender will be unresolved by SSS.

orgSetting.name: DoNotEnforcePrimaryKeyOrgSettingRecycleBin
orgSetting.description: Skip records move to RecycleBin due to PrimaryKey violation

orgSetting.name: BypassBusinessLogicExecutionStepIdsLimit
orgSetting.description: This setting controls the number of steps that can be set in BypassBusinessLogicExecutionStepIds header.

orgSetting.name: AddParentEntityToRelatedOnNewActivityCreate
orgSetting.description: When the value is set to true, the Related column in activity records automatically populates when creating an activity within the context of a parent record. For example, if this setting is enabled, creating a new email activity from the timeline of an account automatically associates that record in the Related column.

orgSetting.name: EnableRoleBasedSystemViews
orgSetting.description: Manage entity list views with security roles, this allows views to be visible or hidden based on end users role.

orgSetting.name: AllowOverwriteMaskedDataToDatabase
orgSetting.description: Warning: enabling (true) this setting will allow fields which are masked using secured masking rules to be updated to values containing masked characters. This means the original unmasked data will be overwritten and masked characters will be stored in the database, and the original values will not be able to be recovered by Microsoft. This should only be enabled if this implication is fully understood and acceptable. When this value is disabled false, the system protects the unmasked data from being overwritten by failing the update request.

orgSetting.name: DisableAutoStubUserRoleAssignment
orgSetting.urlTitle: Create users - How stub users are created
orgSetting.description: When set to 'true', the standard behavior will be overriden and a default security role will NOT automatically be assigned to newly created stub users.

orgSetting.name: SucceededSystemJobPersistenceInDays
orgSetting.description: Retention period for successfully completed system jobs. System jobs older than the retention period will be cleaned by backend deletion service.

orgSetting.name: FailedSystemJobPersistenceInDays
orgSetting.description: Retention period for failed system jobs. System jobs older than the retention period will be cleaned by backend deletion service.

orgSetting.name: CanceledSystemJobPersistenceInDays
orgSetting.description: Retention period for canceled system jobs. System jobs older than the retention period will be cleaned by backend deletion service.

orgSetting.name: EnableSystemJobCleanup
orgSetting.description: Online only setting to enable System Job cleanup from the backend deletion service.
